sub_concepts.name: Reactants
sub_concepts.definition: Substances that undergo a chemical reaction and are changed into new substances.

sub_concepts.name: Products
sub_concepts.definition: Substances that are formed as a result of a chemical reaction.

sub_concepts.name: Reaction Equation
sub_concepts.definition: A shorthand way of representing a chemical reaction by using chemical formulas.

sub_concepts.name: Balancing Chemical Equations
sub_concepts.definition: The process of ensuring that the number of atoms of each element is the same on both sides of the equation.

sub_concepts.name: Law of Conservation of Mass
sub_concepts.definition: The total mass of the reactants equals the total mass of the products.

sub_concepts.name: Catalyst
sub_concepts.definition: A substance that increases the rate of a reaction without being consumed in the process.

sub_concepts.name: Reverse Reactions
sub_concepts.definition: Chemical reactions that can proceed in both the forward and backward directions.

sub_concepts.name: Exothermic and Endothermic Reactions
sub_concepts.definition: Chemical reactions that release or absorb heat, respectively.

sub_concepts.name: Activation Energy
sub_concepts.definition: The minimum energy required for a reaction to occur.

sub_concepts.name: Collision Theory
sub_concepts.definition: A model that explains how reactant molecules must collide with sufficient energy for a reaction to occur.
